titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lumber merchant account book 1979.023
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:45:15 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection consists of one handwritten account book detailing purchases of wood, listing amount and quantities. The merchant, located in New York City, is unknown. The account book is dated 1837 to 1839.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Lumber merchant account book, 1979.023, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Kenn Stryker-Roda, date unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1979.
